thread.title: New Tile hopes to better find lost objects
thread.title_full: New Tile hopes to better find lost objects

title: New Tile hopes to better find lost objects
text:
The Tile location tag uses Bluetooth to help you track down lost objects from your phone. (Photo: Eli Blumenthal, USA TODAY)
9 CONNECT 29 TWEET 21 LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE NEW YORKâ€”In an era of GPS and other location-tracking services in cars, phones, and watches, it's getting easier to keep track of everyday devices.
For non-"smart" devices however, it is much easier to lose or misplace things like luggage, wallets and of course, keys. Enter Tile, the two-year-old company that hopes it can fix that with the second generation of its keychain-like $25 dongle. The locator uses Bluetooth to sync and share its location with an app on iOS and Android devices, and you can use the app to monitor the location of your Tile or "ring" it if you lose it.
The new device, while similar in design to last year's model, boasts a louder speaker and the ability to find your phone or tablet from your keys by clicking on the "e" in the Tile.
USA TODAY's Ed Baig recently caught up with Mike Farley, Tile's CEO, at an event in New York to talk about the new device and what are some of the more interesting products that the company has helped recover (spoiler alert: one of them was a tortoise).
Follow Eli Blumenthal @eliblumenthal
